lexUnit.name: sew.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: join, fasten, or repair by making stitches with a needle and thread or a sewing machine

sentence.text: She read and read and read while her aunt mended the socks of her husband and brothers or sewed innumerable buttons on their shirts .
She sewed buttons on to a white shirt she 'd made .
Again you can pick up the stitches and knit them directly on to the edge , or you can knit long strips or tubes and sew them neatly in place .
At midnight Phyl was still there sewing weights into the gauze curtaining to stop it flapping .
Stick a gold star ( or a dab of nail varnish ) on the bottom button and sew a little red thread on the bottom buttonhole so that she does n't mismatch them .
Mrs Rundle sewed black armbands to their coats , even Victoria 's .
As the spring tides rose , flowing into summer , the Island began to blossom : pots of geraniums appeared on window sills and girls sewed new ribbons on to last year 's straw hats .
She could sew the veil on properly in the morning , before she left .
A plastic teardrop has been sewn on each corner to match the chandeliers .
Several coloured patches were sewn neatly round the seat of his pants .
Surgeons at Odstock Hospital , Wilts , sewed the thumb on .
The belt was ( had been ) three inches wide and made of two strips of cowhide sewn together along their edges .
The meat was then skinned , dressed , cut into ` sides " , sewn into canvas , and placed in refrigerator vans for distribution throughout Britain by the London and North-Western Railway .
NB Straight seam tape can be used instead of pocketed tape , but you will then need to sew on rings individually .
